intro: Sutera caerulea, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that produces clusters of small, blue-violet flowers throughout the summer months. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Sutera caerulea is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
